task.title: Deleting a client certificate by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete client certificates from the truststore by using the delete TrustedCertificate and deleteClientCertificate commands on the command line.

context.p: You can delete a client certificate from the truststore by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete a client certificate, see .

step.cmd: Delete a client certificate in one of the following ways:

choices.choice:
To delete a trusted CA certificate, enter the following command:
imaserver delete TrustedCertificate "TrustedCertificate=certificate" "SecurityProfileName=securityProfile"
Where:
certificate Specifies the name of the trusted CA certificate that you want to delete.
securityProfile Specifies the name of the security profile that is associated with the trusted CA certificate that you want to delete.

To delete a trusted client certificate, enter the following command:
imaserver delete ClientCertificate "CertificateName=certificate" "SecurityProfileName=securityProfile"
Where:
certificate Specifies the name of the trusted client certificate that you want to delete.
securityProfile Specifies the name of the security profile that is associated with the trusted client certificate that you want to delete.
